programme.title: Dark Winds
programme.desc: Lt. Joe Leaphorn and Sgt. Jim Chee investigate the disappearance of a Navajo boy; Manuelito makes a sinister discovery while adjusting to life on the border patrol; an FBI agent comes to solve a case linked to Leaphorn's recent past.

programme.title: Dark Winds
programme.desc: Leaphorn and Chee find themselves on a manhunt after making a shocking discovery; Special Agent Washington questions Leaphorn about a person of interest; Manuelito puts her job on the line when she searches for answers at a local ranch.

programme.title: Dark Winds
programme.desc: After a close call, Leaphorn and Chee follow the trail of a new suspect; the discovery of a body sends Special Agent Washington in a different direction; Manuelito puts a target on her back as she digs deeper into the mystery.

programme.title: Dark Winds
programme.desc: Navajo Tribal Policeman Joe Leaphorn must solve a series of crimes; he partners with new deputy, Jim Chee, who is back on the reservation for the first time since he was a child; together they face down evil forces, both earthly and supernatural.

programme.title: Dark Winds
programme.desc: Leaphorn and Chee interview the surviving witness to the Big Rock Motel murders; Chee meets with the coroner; the cause of death remains a mystery; Sgt. Manuelito makes a chilling discovery of her own.

programme.title: Dark Winds
programme.desc: Leaphorn's niece celebrates her Kinaaldá as Leaphorn retrieves the bodies of the murder victims; Manuelito and Chee investigate the whereabouts of the missing Mormon family.

programme.title: Dark Winds
programme.desc: Leaphorn suspects all of the crimes on the reservation are related; there is a big break in the case; Leaphorn invites Chee over for dinner; Manuelito makes a discovery of her own.

programme.title: Dark Winds
programme.desc: With a major suspect in custody, Leaphorn discovers that there is more to this crime than he would have ever imagined; Manuelito faces her worst fears; Chee must make a choice between his career and his people.

programme.title: Dark Winds
programme.desc: Leaphorn, Chee and Manuelito descend on the hiding place of the Buffalo Society, only to be confronted with hard decisions that could change the outcome of the rest of their lives.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: A dysfunctional blended family is forced together when they realize the onset of the undead apocalypse is upon them.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: Madison tries to keep Nick from withdrawal; Travis sets out to locate his son before Los Angeles falls.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: After they escape a riot, Travis, Liza and Chris seek refuge with the Salazars; Madison defends her home.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: Madison and Travis see different sides of the National Guard's occupation in their neighborhood; the family tries to adapt to the new world.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: The National Guard's plan for the neighborhood is revealed; Travis and Madison make a difficult decision.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: As civil unrest grows, and the dead take over, Travis and Madison try to devise ways to protect their families.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: The families flee Los Angeles on Strand's yacht and find yet more danger at sea.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: The group seeks shelter with a survivalist family; Madison searches for the family's true motives while Salazar tries to uncover Strand's.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: Madison confronts Strand about his undisclosed destination; Nick, Alicia and others inspect a plane crash site.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: The group lets a family in distress board the Abigail; Strand's past begins to come to light; Nick looks for an associate of Strand's.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: Alicia works toward reuniting with her family; Travis comes across a familiar face; Madison and Nick try to save their family against all odds.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: Conflict arises as the Abigail approaches its destination; Chris makes a staggering decision; Nick meets a new maternal figure.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: The family faces their biggest test yet; Nick, Madison, Travis and others try to stay close to each other.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: Nick's search for answers leads him into deadly terrain; a dark part of his past is revealed.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: Madison, Strand and others move forward after the compound falls; Nick gets picked for a dangerous assignment.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: Travis has a hard time connecting with Chris while looking for shelter; Alicia meets a woman with a bloody past.

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: Alicia and Madison try to bring two competing factions together; Nick uses skills from his past for his new role.

programme.title: Life on the Edge
programme.desc: Captain Charlie's cabin build schedule is on the rocks, with a transport boat beached at Volcano Bay and unable to transfer much-needed supplies. Over on Umnak Island, Pat and Connie Harvie and engineer Donovan must use their Aleutian ingenuity to battle the oncoming winter. On Kodiak, Nick Blanco ventures into the wild waters of the Shelikof Strait in search of shoals of silver salmon.

programme.title: North American Whitetail

programme.title: Bowhunter

programme.title: In-Fisherman TV
programme.sub-title: Fire in the Hole and Hold On
programme.desc: It's fast and frenzied fishing as the In-Fisherman staff uses big worms to make big bass and offer they can't refuse; shares footage of the biggest northern pike ever caught in almost 50 years of filming In-Fisherman TV; and tackles spring king salmon in overdrive on the big waters of Lake Ontario.

programme.title: In-Fisherman TV
programme.sub-title: World Class Fisheries & Peak Periods - IFTV - 2024
programme.desc: Secrets are shared and monster fish are brought to the boat or bank, as the In-Fisherman staff goes into multispecies mode for Lake Ontario trout and salmon; heads into wilderness northern Saskatchewan for gator pike; and keys on two peak yearly periods for marauding muskies.

programme.title: South Park: Bebe's B**bs Destroy Society
programme.desc: Bebe's B**bs Destroy Society: Returning from school break, all the boys notice something different about Bebe... out comes the primitive man as they fight to see who'll play with her! (S6, E10)

programme.title: South Park: A Ladder to Heaven
programme.desc: A Ladder To Heaven: The boys break into the McKormick house to try and find a winning ticket. Whilst there Cartman mistakenly drinks Kenny's ashes and starts to have some strange visions... (S6, E12)

programme.title: South Park: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
programme.desc: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers: The boys are dressed up in full 'Middle Earth' gear, and are sent on a quest by Randy to deliver a video to Butter's parents. (S6, E13)
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers

programme.title: South Park: The Death Camp of Tolerance
programme.desc: The Death Camp of Tolerance: Mr. Garrison does what he can to get fired for being gay so he can sue the school for millions of dollars. (S6, E14)

programme.title: South Park: The Biggest Douche in the...
programme.desc: The Biggest Douche in the Universe: Cartman is rushed to hospital after again being possessed by Kenny. Chef believes a TV psychic can help but Stan isn't so sure... (S6, E15)

programme.title: South Park: My Future Self n' Me
programme.desc: My Future Self 'n' Me: After meeting his failed self from the future, Stan decides to avoid drink and drugs - but why does Butters also have a good-for-nothing future self staying with him? (S6, E16)

programme.title: South Park: Red Sleigh Down
programme.desc: Red Sleigh Down: Cartman's 'naughty or nice' accountant informs him that he has been too bad to earn his Christmas gift. All aboard Mr Hankey's Poo-Choo train for a trip to the North Pole! (S6, E17)

programme.title: South Park: Freak Strike
programme.desc: Freak Strike: The boys decide to create a freak in order to win a prize on a TV show - will Butters' case of "Chinballalitis" be enough to win? And will he be discovered by the freaks union? (S6, E03)

programme.title: South Park: Asspen
programme.desc: Asspen: When the boys go on a ski vacation, it's '80s-teen-movie central as Stan is challenged to a ski race by a professional skier named Tad. Only a "montage" can help Stan now! (S6, E02)

programme.title: South Park: The New Terrance and Phillip Move Trailer
programme.desc: The Terrance and Phillip Movie Trailer: The gang are desperate to see the Terrance and Phillip trailer (featuring during 'The Russell Crowe Show') but events conspire against them. (S6, E05)
programme.sub-title: The New Terrance and Phillip Move Trailer

programme.title: South Park: Fun with Veal
programme.desc: Fun With Veal: When the boys discover that veal is made from baby cows they are horrified. Time for a "terrorist" mission to rescue the poor little blighters from their deathly fate! (S6, E04)

programme.title: South Park: Krazy Kripples
programme.desc: Krazy K******s: Christopher Reeve arrives in town and Jimmy and Timmy aren't happy with the attention he gets. They form a club called "The Crips" - unaware of the gang that shares the name! (S7, E02)

programme.title: South Park: Toilet Paper
programme.desc: Toilet Paper: Mrs. Dreibel gives the boys detention for making a phallus out of clay in art class. Angry, they take revenge by toilet papering her house. Officer Barbrady is on their trail. (S7, E03)

programme.title: South Park: Fat Butt and Pancake Head
programme.desc: Fat Butt and Pancake Head: When Cartman wins a diversity event with his offensive hand puppet impersonation of Jennifer Lopez, Kyle is enraged. Soon the real J-Lo turns up, mightily peeved! (S7, E05)

programme.desc: A weekend trip to experience the finer points of camping, fishing and blowing animals to smithereens is threatened by an erupting volcano.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Grandpa's sole birthday wish is for Stan to take part in his assisted suicide. Meanwhile, Mrs. Broflovski has organized a protest against the boys' favorite TV show, "Terrance and Phillip."

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: When Sharon Marsh's Aunt Flo makes a monthly visit, she brings a mysterious pet fish for Stan.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: When the citizens of South Park start exploding randomly, the mayor enlists Stan's dad, the resident geologist, to find a solution to the problem.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Stan's parents drag him along to Mr. Mackey's meteor shower party, where he is sent down into the basement to play with Pip, Butters and Dougie.
programme.sub-title: Two Guys Naked in a Hot Tub

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: While the adults trapped at a time-share sales meeting, Stan is challenged by the best skier on the mountain.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: When a famous psychic fails to help him exorcise Kenny from his body, Cartman and Chef travel to the moors of Scotland, where Chef's mom tries a little of her voodoo magic on him.
programme.sub-title: The Biggest Douche in the Universe

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: When a 32-year-old man claiming to be Stan from the future shows up in South Park, young Stan is forced to come to terms with the loser he will become.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: A Mormon kid moves to South Park and it's up to Stan to kick his ass. But when Stan and his dad meet their new Mormon neighbors, they become fascinated with how genuinely nice they are.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: After Wendy breaks up with Stan the boys take him to 'Raisins,' a local restaurant known for its great chicken wings and hot girls.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: A PETA protest against the use of a cow as South Park Elementary's mascot forces the student body to choose a new one.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Stan agrees to help a group of adorable woodland critters build a manger in anticipation of the birth of their Lord and Savior, only to find out that they serve Satan.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Scientologists converge on Stan's house after he is identified as the reincarnation of L. Ron Hubbard. One A-lister locks himself in the closet and refuses to come out after Stan criticizes his 'talent.'

programme.desc: Cartman finally admits he's fat and immediately gets a mobility scooter.

programme.title: South Park

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman is pursued by the FBI for committing a hate crime and lands in juvenile hall.

programme.title: South Park

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman's family and friends have intervened and are forcing him to trim down. While Cartman's away, Kenny's star is on the rise when he gets his own reality TV show.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: After the other boys explain to Cartman that pubes don't count unless you grow your own, Cartman realizes he's been tricked by the school bully, Scott Tenorman.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman inherits a million dollars from his grandmother and fulfills his lifelong dream of owning his own amusement park: Cartmanland!

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman plans to learn all of Butters' innermost secrets and then use them against him, by pretending to be Butters' new best friend, a robot named AWESOM-O.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: After sustaining a severe head injury, Cartman appears to have the power to see into the future. South Park detectives are quick to enlist his help in cracking unsolved murder cases.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman is sure he's dead and Butters is sure that Eric Cartman's ghost is haunting him. Together they attempt to make amends to all the people Cartman has wronged over the years.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: After the sudden on-set of the disease Gingervitis, Cartman rallies all other ginger kids to rise up and assume their role as the master race.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Al Gore warns the school about the threat of Manbearpig.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: When Cartman's mom realizes she can't control her son anymore, she gets help from an expert. The "Dog Whisperer" may have what it takes but Eric Cartman's not going down without a fight.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: South Park Elementary faces strong opposition to the topic of evolution. Cartman's too busy to notice as he plans to propel himself into the future on the precise release date of the newest, hottest game console.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Eric Cartman has frozen himself in an attempt to make his three-week wait for a Nintendo Wii pass quickly. A freak accident landed him over 500 years in the future and now, he's stuck in a Godless world on the brink of war with no Nintendo Wii.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: When his "ultimate plan" to embarrass Butters backfires, Cartman struggles to keep his classmates from seeing a compromising photograph. Meanwhile, Butters is sent to a special camp where they "Pray the Gay Away."

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman discovers the joys of having Tourette’s syndrome. Drunk with the power of saying whatever he wants without getting in trouble for it, he lines up national TV coverage to take advantage of his new life with no filters.

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman finds himself fighting for his life after a routine tonsillectomy goes wrong. When Kyle becomes infected with Cartman's ailment, the two won't stop for anything as they search for a cure that will reverse their otherwise certain mortality.

programme.desc: The Coon rises from the trash and takes his place as a lone vigilante who wipes out crime in the town of South Park.

programme.title: CBS Weekend News
programme.desc: Journalist Adriana Diaz anchors the Saturday edition of the CBS news program from Chicago, while Jericka Duncan takes the helm of the Sunday broadcast from New York. The two are the latest to fill the roll of weekend anchor, which was most recently represented by Reena Ninan and Eliane Quijano. The program offers the latest headlines, original reporting and in-depth pieces that add context and perspective to the world's events.

programme.title: 60 Minutes
programme.desc: The oldest and most-watched newsmagazine on television gets the real story on America's most prevalent issues. CBS News correspondents contribute segments to each hourlong episode. Topics range from hard news coverage to politics, lifestyle, pop culture, business, health, and science. The correspondents and contributors include Lesley Stahl, Scott Pelley, Anderson Cooper, Bill Whitaker, Sharyn Alfonsi, Jon Wertheim and Norah O'Donnell .

programme.title: CBS Weekend News
programme.desc: Journalist Adriana Diaz anchors the Saturday edition of the CBS news program from Chicago, while Jericka Duncan takes the helm of the Sunday broadcast from New York. The program offers the latest headlines, original reporting and in-depth pieces that add context and perspective to the world's events.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: This newsmagazine investigates intriguing crime and justice cases that touch on all aspects of the human experience. Over its long run, the show has helped exonerate wrongly convicted people, driven the reopening -- and resolution -- of cold cases, and changed numerous lives. CBS News correspondents offer an in-depth look into each story, with the emphasis on solving the mystery at its heart. The program and its team have earned critical acclaim, including multiple Emmy, Peabody and Edward R. Murrow Awards.

programme.title: CBS Weekend News
programme.desc: Journalist Adriana Diaz anchors the Saturday edition of the CBS news program from Chicago, while Jericka Duncan takes the helm of the Sunday broadcast from New York. The two are the latest to fill the roll of weekend anchor, which was most recently represented by Reena Ninan and Eliane Quijano. The program offers the latest headlines, original reporting and in-depth pieces that add context and perspective to the world's events.

programme.title: 60 Minutes
programme.desc: The oldest and most-watched newsmagazine on television gets the real story on America's most prevalent issues. CBS News correspondents contribute segments to each hourlong episode. Topics range from hard news coverage to politics, lifestyle, pop culture, business, health, and science. The correspondents and contributors include Lesley Stahl, Scott Pelley, Anderson Cooper, Bill Whitaker, Sharyn Alfonsi, Jon Wertheim and Norah O'Donnell .

programme.title: CBS News Sunday Morning
programme.desc: The sparkling notes of a trumpet fanfare and the familiar logo of the sun alert viewers that it's time for CBS's Sunday morning staple. Journalist Jane Pauley helms the show, taking over hosting duties from Charles Osgood, who spent 22 years on the job. A morning talk show, this program airs at a different pace and focuses much of its attention on the performing arts. After a quick update of the day's news and national weather, correspondents offer longer-length segments on a variety of topics, from architecture to ballet to music to pop culture to politics.

programme.desc: Larry and Balki bake Myposian pastries in the hopes of making extra money.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry tries to fix Jennifer's pipes himself instead of calling a plumber.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki's Grandma Biki dies while visiting, and Balki pretends nothing unusual happened.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: When Balki graduates first in his night-school class, he hopes for a traditional ceremony and prom.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki and Larry get handcuffed together just before Larry's lunch date with a publisher.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry enlists Balki to help him with his plan to impress his visiting brother.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry is suspicious when Balki claims to have met Olympian Carl Lewis.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki wants to play the lottery, but Larry warns him it's not worth it.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry takes an assertiveness training course and tries to help Balki get a raise.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry watches a horror movie marathon on Halloween, and the next morning he thinks Balki has become an alien.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki volunteers himself (and Larry) to move Lydia's piano up ten flights.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: A rich newspaper owner believes Balki is the Crown Prince of Mypos and invites Larry and Balki to his estate.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Both Larry and Balki hate camping, but Jennifer loves it, so Larry arranges a trip.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: In the second of a two-part episode, Larry leads his lost group around the woods in a circle for five hours.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: As Balki prepares for his college entrance exam, Larry plans a surprise party for Balki.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki invites Mr. Gorpley to the Christmas Eve party.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki hires a maid, but she proves too efficient for Larry.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: After Mary Anne moves to London, Balki joins a bike club known as the Motor Psychos.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry tries to get information for the investigative team.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki compete on a television game show.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Mary Anne and Jennifer are the flight attendants for Balki's first plane trip.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki's trip to the optometrist causes trouble when he's needed as a substitute for the bowling team.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki gets hypnotized and becomes convinced he's Elvis.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki are put in jail after they refuse to reveal a source.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki search for a used car.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Lydia plans to marry a man who Larry and Balki believe is a gigolo.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry comes up with a plan for Balki to win back the money he lost at Mr. Gorpley's poker game.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry teaches a college journalism class, but his standards prove too high for his students.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: On his 25th birthday, Balki gets a surprise from home - a wife.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry incurs the wrath of Myposians when he lies about his roller skating skills to impress Jennifer.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: After a minor car accident, Larry plans to defraud an insurance company to help his sister with her tuition.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: When Balki becomes editor of the office newsletter, Larry gives him advice on how to get the dirt.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki's first trip to the dentist goes wild after Balki and Larry accidentally inhale too much laughing gas.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry reports on a money laundering scheme - prompting the scheme's leader to command the office with a bomb.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki find a secret compartment in the chimney containing clues to the works of a famous poet.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry's father comes to visit, and everyone ends up trapped in the basement - as it fills with water.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and his father finally express their true feelings for each other while trapped in a flooding basement.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: The gang plays golf with Jennifer's father. Larry lets her father win, but Balki doesn't miss a shot.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Despite her fear of cameras, Larry convinces Lydia to try out a talk show version of her advice column for TV.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki tries to make a video of his life to send back to his relatives, but the project turns into a disaster.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki has an uncanny ability to pick winners in the football pool.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki's identical cousin pays a visit and lures him into an investment scam.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry volunteers at the hospital just to get an interview with a patient.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki becomes the negotiator for the sale of a portion of Mypos, and Larry tries to be his adviser.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki take their girlfriends on a trip to paradise - which turns out to be their worst nightmare.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Mary Anne stays with Larry and Balki after an argument with Jennifer.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki are visited by a man who once tried to blow them up, but his visit proves dangerous.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry is confounded after Balki is promoted to an executive position at the newspaper.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: After Larry is accused of stealing office supplies, Balki shows no mercy as head of the grievance committee.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry buys a house in bad repair in the hopes of fixing it up and selling it for a profit.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: The gang and Mr. Gorpley go for an outing at a cabin and wind up capturing an escaped killer.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: When Balki's latest best friend, Yeorgi the Parrot, flies out a window, Larry must face the consequences.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki get the popular host of a children's TV show fired - before trying to get him rehired.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: After thieves ransack Larry and Balki's apartment, Larry installs a sophisticated, high-tech security system.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki takes care of a problem child who's been terrorizing the building, while Larry tries to write a report.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: After breaking up with Larry, Jennifer begins dating an old college boyfriend.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki buy a race horse, but when they learn the horse has a disease, Balki must cure him.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry finds himself caught in the middle of a centuries-long feud between Myposian families.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: When Larry is a passenger on a plane that seems close to crashing, he has a mystical experience.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.sub-title: The Men Who Knew Too Much, Part 1
programme.desc: Larry and Balki are sent to cover the wedding of two soap stars and run into a mobster.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.sub-title: The Men Who Knew Too Much, Part 2
programme.desc: Larry becomes the prime suspect in a murder at the wedding of two soap stars.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry gets duped into buying Jennifer a phony diamond engagement ring, then tries to steal it back from her.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry reads an article about a female serial killer and becomes suspicious of Mary Anne.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry meets a former high school classmate who once mistreated him.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry doesn't want to go to the Youth Center Show where Balki is performing his magic act.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: At a funeral, Larry goes through a corpse's pockets in the hopes of locating the key to a safety deposit box.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Grandpa Appleton pays a visit - along with his much younger girlfriend.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: The Myposian cure for the common cold turns a plant into a monster, as the apartment becomes a den of horrors.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: After Balki tells Larry what happened to Ralph on "The Honeymooners" after a lie, Larry chooses the truth.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: When Jennifer's mother comes to meet Larry, he falls down the steps and suffers from amnesia.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki gets discovered by a music promoter and becomes a rock star.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki runs for student body president and appoints Larry as his campaign manager.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: While doing a promotion for their boss, Larry and Balki get stuck on a billboard with a rotating windmill.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki starts a successful catering business - until he's forced to cater three parties in one night.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki go hunting with their boss, Mr. Wainwright, whom Larry accidentally wounds in the backside.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki and Larry become volunteer firemen.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: When Larry and Jennifer set a wedding date, Balki checks their compatibility with the Myposian Marriage Test.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki has a simple bachelor party planned for Larry, but Mr. Gorpley changes everything when he arrives.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: On their way to the wedding, Larry and Balki are pulled over and arrested after Larry backs into a patrol car.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Jennifer realize they can't afford the new house they just rented.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki take jobs selling cleaning products door-to-door.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: The king of Mypos comes to Chicago for a visit and promptly dies in Larry's arms - making Larry the new king.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki and Larry battle a ghost who has taken up residence in their house.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki want to build a gazebo in the backyard, but they're hampered by their complete lack of skill.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry has Balki's mother flown in as a surprise for Balki, who is about to be sworn in as a U.S. citizen.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry leaves for Mypos to bring Balki back to America, but instead decides he wants to live in Mypos, too.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki believe a lost wedding ring is stuck inside the neighbor's turkey and try to get it back.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: When Larry and Balki collaborate on a new cartoon, tensions between the two rise.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Larry and Balki have an alarm put in the car, but it keeps going off all night.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Balki and Larry are chosen for jury duty the day before their non-refundable vacation to Bermuda begins.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: When Balki's artistic inspiration is stolen, Balki loses the ability to draw his daily comic strip.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: At an auction, Larry mistakenly bids on an expensive bottle of wine.

programme.title: Perfect Strangers
programme.desc: Jennifer's potential pregnancy prompts Larry to dream about the past and future.

programme.title: Catch 21
programme.desc: "Stairway to 21" Players add cards by answering pop trivia questions and try to build the closest hand to 21 without "busting" in this fast-action game of knowledge and strategy.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: "Bookworms vs. Bluffers" Two teams of friends and family race against a clock to guess how America filled in the blanks on a series of survey questions covering every topic under the sun. John Michael Higgins hosts.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: "Bodybuilders vs. Night Shift Nurses" Two teams of friends and family race against a clock to guess how America filled in the blanks on a series of survey questions covering every topic under the sun. John Michael Higgins hosts.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: "Traveling Amigos vs. School Teachers" Two teams of friends and family race against a clock to guess how America filled in the blanks on a series of survey questions covering every topic under the sun. John Michael Higgins hosts.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: "The Davidsons vs. The Johnsons" Two teams of friends and family race against a clock to guess how America filled in the blanks on a series of survey questions covering every topic under the sun. John Michael Higgins hosts.

programme.title: Idiotest
programme.desc: "Church Ladies vs. Back Up Dancer" Comedian Ben Gleib hosts as two friends who met through their church mission trip face off against a back up dancer and her piano teacher boyfriend to answer increasingly difficult brain teaser puzzles.

programme.title: Idiotest
programme.desc: "Music Teacher vs. Gym Owner" Comedian Ben Gleib hosts as a music teacher and her friend face off against a gym owner and his friend to answer increasingly difficult brain teaser puzzles.

programme.title: Idiotest
programme.desc: "Former Camp Counselors vs. Fun Fact Enthusiast" Comedian Ben Gleib hosts as two friends who met as summer camp counselors face off against a man who collects random facts and his friend to answer increasingly difficult brain teaser puzzles.

programme.title: Idiotest
programme.desc: "North vs. South" Comedian Ben Gleib hosts as cousins from Boston with lots of enthusiasm for their hometown face off against a married couple from Dallas who think nothing beats southern hospitality to answer increasingly difficult brain teaser puzzles.

programme.title: Baggage
programme.desc: "Iron Out the Kinks"Jerry Springer hosts as daters decide how much emotional "baggage" to put up with when finding love. A dater must choose between men whose baggage includes ironing clothes to make them look clean and crying during Zac Efron movies.

programme.title: Baggage
programme.desc: "Silent Partner" Jerry Springer hosts as daters decide how much emotional "baggage" they are willing to put up with when finding love. A dater must choose between women whose baggage includes going for weeks without talking and peeing in swimming pools.

programme.title: Baggage
programme.desc: "Put Your Feet Up" Jerry Springer hosts as daters decide how much emotional "baggage" to put up with when finding love. A dater must choose between women whose baggage includes making boyfriends get pedicures and refusing to eat red, white and blue foods.

programme.title: Baggage
programme.desc: "Boyfriend Stalker"Jerry Springer hosts as daters decide how much emotional "baggage" to put up with when finding love. A dater must choose between women whose baggage includes requiring her boyfriend to live across the street and using the men's room.

programme.title: Mind of a Man

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: The all-time female money leader on the WPT, JJ Liu, returns to Los Angeles.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: WPT champion Van Nguyen leads the way as six of the finest female poker players battle.

programme.title: WPT Foundation Ladies Night 2014 - Part 1
programme.desc: The women rule the poker table at WPT Ladies’ Night from the Bicycle Casino in Los Angeles. Part 1 of 2.

programme.title: WPT Foundation Ladies Night 2014 - Part 2
programme.desc: The women rule the poker table at WPT Ladies’ Night from the Bicycle Casino in Los Angeles. Part 2 of 2.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: The Final Table of the first ever WPT Ladies Championship at Wynn Las Vegas is set.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: Six talented poker competitors remain in the first ever WPT Ladies Championship.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: Kathy Leibert finds herself as the shortest stack at the table with only four women remaining.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.desc: Only three ladies remain in the battle for over $100,000 and the title of WPT Ladies Champion.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.sub-title: WPT Seminole Hard Rock Poker Showdown - Part 1
programme.desc: The WPT Seminole Hard Rock Poker Showdown Championship has reached a final table where six remaining players compete for a first place prize of over $1 million dollars and the coveted title of WPT Champion.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.sub-title: WPT Seminole Hard Rock Poker Showdown - Part 2
programme.desc: WPT Seminole Hard Rock Poker Showdown Championship final table action heats up as the massive field of 2,290 entrants has been narrowed to the final five.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.sub-title: WPT Seminole Hard Rock Poker Showdown - Part 3
programme.desc: The final table of the WPT Seminole Hard Rock Poker Showdown Championship has come down to a thrilling heads-up battle. With $1.1 million on the line, just two players remain in the hunt for the title, but only one will emerge as the next WPT Champion.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.sub-title: WPT Daniel Arsham Celebrity Invitational - Part 1
programme.desc: The World Poker Tour proudly presents the WPT Daniel Arsham Celebrity Invitational Sit and Go, a single table poker event bringing together an exciting lineup of star power and poker talent.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.sub-title: WPT Daniel Arsham Celebrity Invitational - Part 2
programme.desc: The WPT Daniel Arsham Celebrity Invitational Sit and Go continues as the star-studded cast of players battle for the custom Veiled Porsche sculpture created by renowned contemporary artist Daniel Arsham.

programme.title: World Poker Tour
programme.sub-title: WPT Daniel Arsham Celebrity Invitational - Part 3
programme.desc: From a field of six, only four players remain in the WPT Daniel Arsham Celebrity Invitational Sit and Go.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: A man shows up and claims to be Stanley's son. Stanley admits to know his mother, but doesn't remember the night that she claimed to conceive her son. Roper goes to talk to a friend who was with him at the time to find out if the claims are true.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen adores the Brookes' boy, David, which leads her to feel she and Stanley could adopt a baby. Stanley is against it. Still, she calls an agency and sets up a home interview.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley's going to be in trouble if Helen finds out he's lost her new puppy "Muffin" on a walk. He decides that a look-alike just might fool her and get him off the hook. Will Stanley get away with it or be barked at by Helen?

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The clock Stanley gives Helen for their anniversary turns out to be stolen from Brookes' apartment.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: On the day that Helen is making dinner to impress her rich sister, Ethel, the utilities are cut off because Stanley forgot to pay the bills. He goes to great lengths to hide his mistake.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Both Stanley and Jeffrey argue with their wives and walk out on them at the same time. Getting drunk at a bar brings them together as buddies, but sobering up may open their eyes to a big problem they've unwittingly created.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: A fire in the kitchen leads to the Ropers having to stay with the Brookes family until their place is ready again. However, Stanley's behavior gets on Jeffrey's last nerve.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack butts heads with James on a radio debate show.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack seeks advice from a psychologist about his recent impotence. Vicky thinks Jack is cheating on her with E.Z.'s girlfriend Susie.

programme.desc: Jack convinces Vicky to invest in a case of vintage wine, but when it turns out to be sour, he takes a job at a sushi house to repay her.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: When Jack is asked to identify a counterfeiter, Mr. Bradford appears in the police lineup.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack lies to his visiting Aunt Mae to try to cover up his living arrangement with Vicky. Jack hires surfer E.Z. Taylor as his assistant at the restaurant.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: Jack and Vicky argue over money. Mr. Bradford offers to pay for sprinklers that Jack needs for the bistro if Jack can convince Vicky to marry him.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: James tries to match his ex-wife with a business acquaintance, hoping to cease paying her alimony.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: James moves in to care for Vicky when she comes down with the measles.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: To get Vicky to accept his standing marriage proposal, Jack attempts to reunite Vicky's divorced parents. First appearance of Mrs. Bradford.

programme.desc: Vicky's former boyfriend opens a seafood restaurant across from Jack's Bistro and makes Jack jealous.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Mrs. Roper thinks her husband is having an affair when she finds his hidden stash of love letters , written to a woman named Doris.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's mother comes for a visit. But later it is revealed that she has no place to go. So Helen and her two sisters get together to decide what to do, cause none of them really want her living with them.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's luncheon makes her consider leaving the Cheviot Hills neighborhood. Stanley believes her and, without asking, has Jeffrey Brookes put their home on the market. Will The Ropers really relocate?

programme.desc: Christian is preparing for his first vacation in years. His plane leaves in an hour but he's lingering at the store. programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Marlene's friendship with a young couple seems to be blossoming into something more. They want her to be their surrogate mother and she agrees.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Marlene introduces Christian to her friend Barbara and the two of them have an instant attraction to each other. He is shocked to learn that Barbara has a 10 year old son. Bannister is planning on hosting a circus.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Derek the bagboy has a special admiration for Bannister. Everything's going well until it's we learn that he plans on working at Cobb's forever in order to become the next Howard Bannister.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister hires a new cashier at Cobb's. She takes a special liking to Bannister and one night while they're alone, she grabs him and kisses him. Bannister learns Kim has made a practice of suing her former bosses.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister is approached by the local Businessmen's Association to run in the upcoming election for city councilman.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: When Leslie announces that he will be attending a seminar for potential investors, he asks Bannister to go with him. Bannister, willing to do anything to miss the Opera with Edna, reluctantly agrees.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Christian asks Bannister for a favour when he learns that his mother is coming for a surprise visit.

programme.desc: After Jack and James get drunk together, James is arrested for urinating in public and ends up in court.

programme.desc: Good morning, fishermen from the Eastern Sierras! It's trout time in God's country. Last week, Ryan, Dixie, and I embarked on a six-hour road trip to Bishop, California, with a short 45-minute drive up the mountain to Parcher's Resort. After settling into our comfortable cabin, we kicked off our adventure with some creek fishing. Today on Stoked on Fishing, we're headed to South Lake to fish with Jared, owner and operator of Parcher's Resort and Sierra Slammer Trout Baits. We'll hop on one of his pontoon boats for a three-hour afternoon session.

programme.title: Angling Buzz - Summer Midwest Fishing
programme.desc: It's late June and right now it's primetime for hot river fishing across the Upper Midwest for a variety of different reasons. Number one would be the low stable flows of the rivers, most of the rivers are also running fairly clear. Number two is it puts fish in fairly identifiable areas in the river thanks to the current. programme.title: Stoked on Fishing - Back Country Trout Fishing
programme.desc: What a journey it's been over the last three weeks! We kicked off our adventure in Eastern Sears Creek, making our first casts to see what the waters would yield. From there, we headed to South Lake for some laid-back pontoon trout fishing. After a relaxing day by the lake, complete with apple pie and cold beverages, we followed expert advice from Jared to venture back into the heart of nature. Our trek led us to Long Lake, nestled just above South Lake, offering more stunning views and fishing spots. Today on Stoked on Fishing, we're picking up where we left off. We'll dive deeper into understanding the lakes, figuring out what the rainbow and brook trout are biting on, and trying our best to land a few. Join us as our backcountry adventure continues.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Todd Rogers embraces the business of being a hunting outfitter as a labor of love. And while so many family-run operations are dwindling in rural America, the Rogers legacy is here to stay. Will Cooper and Josh Dahlke return to western Oklahoma to share this story while pursuing brush-country whitetails in the red dirt.

programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: Behind The Draw

programme.desc: Mike makes a wild stalk on a beautiful velvet mule deer buck. The entire week was a week to remember filled with many ups and downs. We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 1 of this epic Montana bowhunt!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Can You Surf & Eat Like a Local in Minnesota? Wild Foraging & Delicious Local Eats"
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Exploring New York City's Hidden Culinary Gems: Cooking Goat Brains, Lobster & MORE"
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Alaskan Fishing, Foraging, & Mountainside Cooking with Local Legends"
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

Guided by Alex Burgess, Ryan tackles sailfish and tuna while mastering kite fishing. The adventure continues with his family as they enjoy a thrilling hydrofoil ride in Jupiter, Florida, blending fishing excitement with family fun on the water.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Watch along as Jay learns to clean fish from ‪@reedthefishmonger‬. Watch the full video and learn to clean any fish.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.sub-title: "Fly Fishing Giant Jacks in Stuart Florida"
programme.desc: Jay and Casey link up with Captain Mike Holiday to chase giant jacks off the beach. Casey got schooled last time, he's looking for redemption.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: From Miami to Apalachicola Bay, Florida, Capt. Jonathan Moss revisits some of his favorite moments from this season.

programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When overnight temps go low and the tides go lower, it forces Redfish to move. Justin & Travis break out a new micro skiff to see how low they can go to ambush shifting redfish on the flats.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s playtime for Travis & Justin when offshore guide Josh Sauls shares a secret honey hole and his fishing ancestry. Then luck shines when the guys find another sweet spot on the way back.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: The irresistibly serene gulf waters off Panama City Beach lure Justin into taking Capt. Ed Zyak out to see what's biting. It quickly turns into a study session and a lesson. Patience + perseverance = success.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin has spent a lifetime buying, selling and rigging boats to fit his angling needs. Learn what you need to ask yourself before shopping for the perfect boat and what to look for at the dealership.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: We kick off Season 2 in Tennessee where we stop in Nashville, Townsend, and Johnson City!!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Alex explore the SS United States; the world‘s largest artificial reef.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh heads offshore for the first day of red snapper season with his friend Joe Koenraad.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Legendary Pro Skateboarders Mike McGill and Bucky Lasek of the Bones Brigade join Nick for high-flying dorado action off SoCal and Mexico.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Jersey Shipwrecks hold beastly blackfish as Nick hops aboard with three top blackfish captains to target trophy tautog using jigs and secret methods.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Early winter in Key West means wahoo is on everyone’s mind and Ali and Rush are ready to put in the lures and the time to get it done. Once the conditions line up it’s time to go all in, wahoo or bust.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Fish tacos are about as SoCal as it gets and on this visit to San Diego, Ali takes Rush fishing on a rockfish and lobster "grocery run". Slow pitch jigging and hoop netting are the techniques of choice and the rewards are delicious.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Guatemala to fish with David Salazar at Casa Vieja Lodge aboard the latest addition to the fleet. If this boat could talk, the tales of record breaking fish and world travels would be endless and Dave’s big plans for it are sure to make for an exciting new chapter.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The boys are back in the Florida Keys fishing with Capt. Tony Murphy from the Saltwater Angler tackle shop in Key West aboard his 32’ SeaVee. Tony takes the boys into the Gulf of Mexico to chase Permit on wrecks using live crabs for bait. The Gulf doesn’t disappoint and also provides plenty of action from other Florida Keys species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When the weather in San Diego throws the crew a curveball, Ali, Rush and friend Brandon Nelson put together plan B. Targeting Yellowtail and Mako sharks, the guys search for kelp paddies on the horizon and look to friend at the fish house for some “shark attractant” to make it all come together.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell brings some game changing technology along as he joins Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor for some nighttime tarpon fishing at the Long Key Bridge.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: "Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor patiently pursue big tarpon from the Everglades to the Middle Keys with fly rod in hand.".

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Richard Black for an exciting adventure in Key Largo, catching a wide variety of fish species on the shallow reef.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Jeff Malone to find a frenzy of exciting Bluefish near Marathon, FL.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Jeff Malone to find a productive wreck with which they enjoy the exciting variety of fish that wrecks can provide.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss travels to Melbourne, on Florida’s Space Coast, to cast flies with Capt. Noah Miler at some unforgettable fish.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the local Key West ship wrecks covered in Permit, Rush takes good friend and marine artist KC Scott fishing for "inspiration." While permit is the plan, the boys stay rigged and ready for the numerous species the Florida Keys may deliver when fishing offshore.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode we will dive the beautiful reefs and wrecks of Key Largo. We will showcase research that is being done in Key Largo to protect reefs worldwide.

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.sub-title: "Lake Okeechobee - A Look Inside Pro Bass Fishing"
programme.desc: In the second episode, we follow Mike Iaconelli to the Bassmaster Elite Series on legendary Lake Okeechobee. As the camera rolls, we dive deep into the fishing world, shedding light on the industry and exploring the untold stories from Ike’s incredible 30-year career on the road. - From behind-the-scenes moments to raw, unfiltered insights, this episode peels back the curtain on what it really takes to thrive in professional fishing. Get ready for some dirt, real talk, BIG FISH, and an up-close look at one of the sport’s most legendary figures.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Similar to any good Cajun dish, a successful duck camp requires preparation. The last day on dry land is filled with essential stops to get ready for 5 days on the Bayou. Whether making sure we have the right ingredients for our favorite meals, or getting the boats brushed up and ready for action, the day before can be just as important as the day of.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny meets up with Jeff Coffee of ZOE angling group to talk shop, tie flies and fish in one of the most biodiverse lakes in the country.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.sub-title: "Alaska's Massive Marvels: A Boating Expedition through America's Last Frontier Pt 2
programme.desc: From battling towering 12-foot waves in the Gulf of Alaska, to reeling in colossal 200 lb. halibut, they discover firsthand the rugged beauty of America's 49th state. This episode highlights Lindell Yachts as a top builder of rugged offshore sportfishing yachts, as well as Radon Boats as great pilothouse fishing and guide boats.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Louisiana's Wild Food & Award-Winning Cuisine - Hog Hunting, Swamp Fishing & MORE"
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: READY TO ROLL!!…almost - We have our bus. We have our boat. And we have Mr. J. Rockfish on board to steer the ship. But before we can hit the road, we’ve got some work to do. - The bus…it needs a new motor and maybe some other stuff (TBD) that’s been hiding under 40 years of crust and crud… - The boat, it needs some fiberglass work. A casting platform and floor would be cool…maybe a paint job. - And Jay, well his gear is pretty shot, and his normally ripped physique has been obscured under some COVID poundage he acquired over the past year or so…And maybe a pedicure and haircut are in order before stepping in front of the camera… - First, the bus. A little interior decorating perhaps. - The 14 seats built for preschoolers don’t quite accommodate over-sized fishing dudes. And, come to find out, there are no rod racks. No bar. No stereo. No beds. No fly-tying stations. And no beer fridge. How did those kids survive? - Time to gut this thing…Check it out! #fishingwithjay.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.sub-title: "Fly Fishing For Snook in Indian River Lagoon"
programme.desc: With Tampa Bay suffering from a tragic red tide, Court left his home waters to fish with Jay and Casey in our backyard, the flats of Indian River and Mosquito Lagoon.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh heads offshore for the first day of red snapper season with his friend Joe Koenraad.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Cable is a huge supporter of Texas Hunting and everything Teas Trophy Hunters. We are blessed to spend a few days with hum at the beautiful Saddle Creek Ranch in Brady Texas. Greg has a tight management plan and we are glad we got to enjoy his ranch with him and his team.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Exploring New York City's Hidden Culinary Gems: Cooking Goat Brains, Lobster & MORE"
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Alaskan Fishing, Foraging, & Mountainside Cooking with Local Legends"
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of Team Winchester shooters Zach Kienbaum and Desirae Edmunds is told. Zach and Desi discuss how they got started in the shooting sports and how important coaching has become to both of them. They also talk shooting tips. Theo Ribbs breaks down the shotgun sports while Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Paul Sawyer, Nikki Boxler and Gabe Adair have a friendly sporting clays competition.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The Pacific Northwest does not have the easiest conditions to train in for this shooting sports team. For this Seattle-based SST Ravens, this skeet and trap team finds that the challenging weather they train in comes in handy when competing. Also: Competition shooting tips form pro shooter Theo Ribbs.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every spring brings a new opportunity to take a step forward & recall the memories of seasons past. World War II Veteran and retired Judge Arden Hill has spent most of his life chasing turkeys in the hills of Tennessee. Now in his 90’s, Arden doesn’t let age stand in the way of his love for spring turkey hunting. Also: patterning turkey shotguns and hunting spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Winchester introduces the Shoot United brand aimed at offering useful information and tips to the millions of new shooters entering the shooting sports. New York native and Midland University competitive shotgun shooter Amy Cawley and her journey as a student-athlete is followed. Also: Theo Ribbs gives shooting tips for competition and Foster Bartholow reviews Winchester AA Diamond Grade.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at - John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY. They are checking out some of the damage done to John’s pontoon decking from freezing weather they received. John and the team are upgrading the material, and adding carpeting to the pontoon decking. We also get some information on SPX-Johnson bilge pumps and the ease of access they provide.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at - John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interlux’s paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.sub-title: "Opening Week in Mississippi started off with a BANG!!"
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When overnight temps go low and the tides go lower, it forces Redfish to move. Justin & Travis break out a new micro skiff to see how low they can go to ambush shifting redfish on the flats.

programme.desc: Justin has spent a lifetime buying, selling and rigging boats to fit his angling needs. Learn what you need to ask yourself before shopping for the perfect boat and what to look for at the dealership.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.desc: Charter boat captain Mike Macko recounts his grueling life in the engine room aboard a U.S. Navy ship in the South Pacific theatre.

programme.desc: Catch all of the deer that have hit the dirt over the last few seasons on The Raven right here.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma getting the Oklahoma turkey season kicked off.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.sub-title: "Second Chance - Hunting the November Rut in Ohio"
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Knowing when to spot and stalk is crucial for any hunter. In this episode of DDH-TV, Mark Kayser breaks down three key factors for success, while Dan Schmidt puts them into action as he stalks a buck in Nebraska’s Sandhills.

programme.title: Pure Hunting
programme.desc: Good friend Mike Stone invites Willi to hunt his family ranch in Oklahoma. Good friend, Tom Petry goes along to film for his school, “Film The Hunt” and hopefully capture Willi shooting a good, Oklahoma buck.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cooks Tour Cod Crazy
Anthony Bourdain A Cooks Tour Cobra Heart Foods That Make You Manly
Anthony Bourdain A Cooks Tour Dining With Geishas
21 Years Richard Linklater
programme.desc: Animated sequences and interviews with Matthew McConaughey, Ethan Hawke, Billy Bob Thornton, Jason Reitman and others illustrate the career of groundbreaking director Richard Linklater.

programme.title: Miss Conception
programme.desc: Georgina (Heather Graham) is a successful businesswoman living in London. She believes the only thing missing in her life is a baby, but her boyfriend (Tom Ellis) doesn't want kids. To make matters worse, Georgina's doctor (Nicholas Le Prevost) informs her that she has only one egg left, and she'll be ovulating only for the next four days.

programme.title: Addicted to Fresno
programme.desc: Two sisters (Natasha Lyonne, Judy Greer) stage a cover-up when one accidentally kills a guest at the hotel where they work as maids.

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: Three suburban English families' lives intertwine with tragic consequences.

programme.title: Brooklyn Rules
programme.desc: Brooklyn, 1985. With the mob world as a backdrop, three life-long friends struggle with questions of love, loss and loyalty.

programme.title: Resistance
programme.desc: After the Nazis successfully invade Britain, a German platoon reaches the Welsh valleys, only to find that all the men of the region have headed for the hills to muster a resistance movement.

programme.title: What Lies Ahead
programme.desc: When two young women are thrown together on an unexpected road trip, an aggressive peril emerges between them that grows stronger with each passing mile.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cooks Tour Cobra Heart Foods That Make You Manly
Slipstream
programme.desc: In a futuristic world savaged by the slipstream wind, bounty hunter Matt snatches a murderer with a price of his head from lawman Will Tasker.

programme.title: A Boy And His Dog
programme.desc: Vic (Don Johnson) is a libidinous 18-year-old traversing the post-apocalyptic desert of 2024, in the company of his telepathic dog, Blood. When the pair encounter an underground community, the leader's daughter, Quilla Holmes (Susanne Benton), seduces Vic into their fold, separating him from Blood, who's left to survive on his own. But once Vic discovers he's been lured there solely for mechanized procreation, he realizes he's doomed unless he can escape and rejoin Blood.

programme.title: Alice Sweet Alice
programme.desc: Favorite daughter Karen (Brooke Shields) is viciously strangled and set afire in church on the day of her First Communion, and suspicion falls on her jealous and emotionally unstable sister, Alice (Paula E. Sheppard). When the girls' aunt, Annie (Jane Lowry), is later stabbed on an apartment complex stairway, Alice is sent away. But the attacks continue, prompting priest Father Tom (Rudolph Willrich) and Alice's dad, Dominick (Niles McMaster), to go in search of the real killer.

programme.title: One-Eyed Jacks
programme.desc: After pulling a bank heist in Mexico, the outlaw Rio (Marlon Brando) and his partner, Dad Longworth (Karl Malden), make a run for it, but Dad has bigger plans than freedom. He betrays Rio and absconds with the loot, and Rio ends up in prison.
